I also gave this answer to Gene in email, but I wanted to answer here as =
well for others that may be curious:

In fact, there is a solution to the n=
o-velocity version that has only a single hidden neuron.  In fact, there is=
 a solution with no hidden neurons (which must have a recurrent connection =
on the output).  The pole balancing tasks turned out to require much less s=
tructure than was thought, which is something NEAT discovered.

ken

--- In=
 neat@yahoogroups.com, "genemerdock" <genemerdock@...> wrote:
>
> I'm exper=
iencing some strange behavior from NEAT, I've rewritten the Double Pole Wit=
hout Velocities and with Damping recently using another language, and plugg=
ed it back in. 
> 
> After running the experiment many times, every once in=
 a rare while NEAT manages to solve the Double Pole Balancing without veloc=
ities and with Damping experiment using 1 Neuron. Is the 1 Neuron solution =
possible, or have I made a mistake somewhere while rewriting the experiment=
.
>
